July 13, 1959
Mr* Fernand Terrou, President
International Association for Mass
Communication Research
27, Rue Saint-Guillaume
Paris VIIE, France
Dear Sir
Your letter and documents of June 12, 1959, addressed to the
National Association of Educational Broadcasters in this country,
have been forwarded to me for reply* As chairman of the research
committee of the NAEB, it was felt that I might best respond* The
members of my committee would be the ones most interested in the
research and bibliography sections of the proposed Bulletin and
would provide most of the information from here for the Bulletin.
Before we can proceed, however, additional information would
be helpful. You mention documentation cards. It is not clear to
me whether these refer to the forms on which we are to submit in¬
formation to you, or whether these are duplicate sets of information
items which will appear in the Bulletin. It would be helpful if we
knew which they were and how much they would cost us. If the docu¬
mentation cards are the actual bibliographical items, I would guess
that many libraries in this country would be interested in receiving
these as they come out* I would like to know then how much these
would be for non-members of the association or how much a subscrip¬
tion to the Bulletin would be, since it would also contain all of the
same information*
I would assume that we could probably be of most help here by
appointing a different member of our research committee to be re¬
sponsible for submitting information for each section of the Bulletin.
What would you think of this? When do you want to start getting
items? How far in the past should we go for the bibliographical
items?
In regard to your questionnaire on which sections of the Associ¬
ation most interest us, is it possible for different members of the
NAEB to be listed as members of different sections? If not, I suppose
that, as chairman of our research committee, I should be listed for
all sections so that we have a complete file of the Association
activities.
